name: Sangri Ki Shikampuri
instructions: Soak Sangri in water for 1 hour.
In a heavy bottom pan heat ghee and add whole spices along with whole red chilly.
Add sangri, chana dal and salt to the pan.
Cook it till water is complete reduced.
Remove from heat and cool it down.
Mince the mixture to a fine paste and add rose water with a little salt to taste.
If the mixture is too soft add roasted channa flour to it.
Divide the mixture into equal balls and stuff it with cheese.
Press them to make galletes and shallow fry in ghee till golden brown.
Serve hot with mint chutney.
20 gCarbs
20 gFats
20 mgCholesterol
20 gProtien
30gFiber

name: Crunchy Iceberg Dumpling
instructions: To prepare the filling, blanch all the vegetables together except the iceberg and keep it aside till itcools down.
Mix the rest of the ingredients with the blanched vegetables to form the filling.
Prepare the skin by using wheat starch and water in order to make a dough.
Cut and divide the dough into equals and use a roller to make wrapper.
Insert filling and fold into dumplings.
Serve hot.

name: Spanish Artichoke And Spinach Dip
instructions: Take 200 grams of fresh spinach and blanch in hot water, soak spinach in chilled water for 5-7 minutes.
Squeeze and drain all the water from the spinach.
Take one medium sized onion and chop finely.
Add 25 grams of chopped garlic and toss in olive oil on high flame.
Add bechamel sauce & fresh cream to the pan.
Add nutmeg and salt to taste. Let the mixture cool down and put in blender and grind for desired consistency.
Return the mix to the pan and add lime-juice and cubed artichoke hearts. Add burnt garlic for garnish. Serve warm.
For the Tortilla Chips:
Take 25 grams of polenta, 20 grams of refined flour and a pinch of salt and half a cup of water and knead until mixed well.
Roll with a rolling pin until thin. Cut the tortilla sheet into triangular shapes.
3.  Fry and serve with dip.
For the Bechamel Sauce
Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat.
Add flour, cook, stirring, with a wooden spoon, for 1 to 2 minutes or until mixture bubbles.
Gradually stir in milk and bring it to boil.
Reduce heat to medium. Cook, stirring, for 4 to 5 minutes or until mixture thickens.

name: Grilled Vegetable Lasagne
ingredients: 1 Tbsp garlic (chopped)       1/4 cup zucchini (green)        1/4 cup zucchini (yellow)     1/4 cup broccoli                  2 asparagus stick
1/3 cup butter                      1/2 cup all purpose flour     1 tsp salt                           1/2 tsp nutmeg powder     1 cup milk
instructions: For the White Sauce:
Heat the butter in  saucepan over low heat until melted.
Add in the flour and nutmeg.
Cook over low heat stirring constantly until it forms bubble.
Remove from heat and add in milk.
Increase the flame, stir constantly till the first boil.
Cover and keep warm (if sauce thickens add a small amount of milk).
For the Lasagna:
Cook the lasagna sheets as directed on package.
Drain lasagne sheets with hot water.
Pre-heat the oven to 280 degrees.
In a pan, heat some oil and saute all the veggies with garlic.
Add some water. Cover and cook for 3 to 4 minutes until it gets crisp and tender.
In a 10x8 inch baking dish, layer a lasgana sheet and pour the sauce.
Add the vegetable mixture and half of the Mascarpone cheese.
Repeat all layers, sprinkle with Mozzarella cheese and Parmesan cheese.
Bake at 280 degrees for 20 to 25 minutes.

name: Greek Style Pizza
ingredients: 1/2 tsp yeast.          1/2 tsp salt              1/4 cup water         1 tsp sugar          1 Tbsp olive oil

1/2 cup pizza sauce                        2/3 cup pizza cheese                    1/2 tsp chilly flacks                     1/2 tsp fresh oregano                1/4 avocado                        1/4 cup zucchini green/yellow
instructions: Pre heat the oven to the maximum temperature and defrost the cheese.
Mean while you can prepare the dough for base. Dissolve yeast in a lukewarm water in a mixing bowl. Add salt and Pizza flour to it and make a loose dough.
Knead for 10 minutes to smooth the dough. If it's sticky. You can sprinkle some more floor and knead. Keep it covered in a counter top.
Cut a baking sheet to square place the dough over it. Roll thinly like a (roti). Dust with flour. Using a back of a board spoon spread the pizza sauce.
Spread the chopped veggies and sprinkle cheese over it, sprinkle the Italian seasoning transfer by pulling this  over a baking tray carefully.
Bake for 15 minutes or until the side and cheese become golden.
Pizza is ready to be served hot.

name: Mapo Tofu with Spring Onion and Black Beans
ingredients: 300 gms diced silken tofu            1/2 tsp sichuan oil                                    2 Tbsp cooking oil                     1 tsp spicy black bean                           100 ml water                                          1/2 tsp dark soy                                       1/2 tsp red chili powder                   1/2 tsp sugar                   1 tsp spring onions, chopped                   2 Tbsp leeks sliced                       2 Tbsp water
instructions: Heat cooking oil and Sichuan oil in wok or pan, put chili bean paste, spicy black bean, sauté it.
Add ginger, garlic, chili powder and sauté for a while.
Add dark soy and water.
Put silken tofu, leeks, spring onion, and add sugar, let it boil for 2 minutes.
Meanwhile take a stainless steel bowl put potato starch and water to prepare thickening starch .
Adjust the thickening with potato starch and add it.
Serve hot

name: Sweet Potato Rice
instructions: Heat oil in a pan.
Add garlic and fry till slightly brown in color.
Add sweet potatoes and salt , fry till half cooked.
Add chilli powder and ginger juice, cook it fully.
Add spring onion and mix well.
Add cooked rice and mix well.
Switch it off and serve hot.

name: Dal Bafla
instructions: For the Bafla
In a large bowl, mix all the ingredients together to make a stiff dough, adding a little water at a time.
Divide the dough into smaller balls, and roll them using your palms to make them smoother.
Bring water to a boil in a large pan. Add salt and turmeric, and then drop the balls and cook till they float on the surface.
Place them on a kitchen towel to drain excess water.
Once they are dried, bake them in the oven at 150 degree C for till crisp and golden on both the sides.
For the Dal

Pressure cook the dal in 3 ½ cups of water for 3 whistles, by adding salt and turmeric powder. Let the steam escape and then add the hing and stir well. Add a little water if it is too thick, and bring to a boil.
Meanwhile, heat ghee in a pan, add mustard seeds and let it splutter.
Add red chilli powder, and quickly pour this tadka in the boiling dal. Add sugar and remove from the flame. Finish with coriander leaves.
To Serve
Place two Baflas on a plate, crumble them using your fingers, add a teaspoon of ghee, and pour the dal on top.

name: Aloo Palda
ingredients: 3 potatoes, peeled and chopped into finger fries
2 tablespoons of raw rice and 3 green cardamoms (grind with 4 tablespoons of water)
instructions: Heat 2 tablespoons of ghee.
Add 1 black cardamom, 1 strip of cinnamon bark, 5-6 cloves, pinch of hing and 1 teaspoon of cumin seeds.
Add the sliced onions
Add 2 teaspoons of coriander powder, ¾ teaspoon turmeric, 1 teaspoon garam masala and salt.
Add the potatoes and mix well.
Cover and cook on medium heat for 15 minutes till potatoes are almost cooked.
Mix the ground rice with the whisked yogurt.
Add the yogurt mixture to potatoes and keep stirring on medium heat till the gravy comes to a boil.9. Let it boil additionally for 5 minutes.
Add salt and cilantro and serve hot.

name: Auriya Kaddu
ingredients: 1 tablespoon panch phorun ( combination of 5 whole spices - available at any Indian store)
instructions: Heat mustard oil.
Add the panch phorun and asofetida.
Add 2-3 whole chili and fry.
Add the chopped pumpkin and mix well.
Cook for about 15 minutes until the pumpkin is soft.
Add turmeric and salt to taste.
Cook for a few minutes and then add the dry mango powder.
Mash the pumpkin and take off the heat.
Let the pumpkin dish cool.
Add the ground mustard mixture and mix well.
Serve warmed.

name: Khatta
instructions: For the Boondies:1. In a bowl whisk together all the ingredients for the boondi with water.
Heat 5-6 cups of mustard oil for frying.
Sieve the boondi batter through a sieve with rounded holes and fry the boondi till crisp but do not brown.
Set aside.
For the Khatta Gravy:1. Heat 4 tablespoons of mustard oil.
Add 1/2 teaspoon methi seeds, dalchini, moti eilachi and 1/2 teaspoon of hing (asafetida).
Combine and add the coriander powder, besan, chili powder, turmeric, amchur powder, salt and mix well.
Add 10 cups of water and stir very well smoothing out any bumps and bubbles.
Boil for 15 minutes. Add the boondi and boil for 5 minutes.
Take the pot off the fire and set aside as the mixture will thicken.
Garnish with chopped cilantro. Serve hot with white rice.

name: Hoagie Salad (Cucumber Salad)
ingredients: 2 pieces or more hot green chillies
instructions: Cut the cucumber and green chilli uniformly.

Then put in a bowl and add Sichuan pepper, salt, red chilli flakes and crumble the cheese.Toss it well so that it gets mixed well.3. Now put some leaves of coriander and mix it. Add few drops of oil. 4. Garnish with coriander sprigs and serve it.

name: Ema Datshi (Chilli with Cheese)
ingredients: 10-15 pieces green or red chillies, sliced 1 ball of local Bhutanese cheese 1/2 onion bulb, sliced 2 Tbsp butterSalt to taste
instructions: Heat butter in a pot with a thick base. To this, add a sliced onion. Saute till it becomes translucent. Add sliced chillies and cook in water. Now add salt, butter and cheese. Slow down the fire and don't mix till the cheese melts. When the cheese gets melted and looks creamy, combine everything. Check for salt. Serve it with Bhutanese red rice.

name: Capsicum Masala
ingredients: 1 cup of diced green capsicum and red and yellow bell peppers
instructions: Roast the peanuts and sesame seeds. Grind to make a fine paste. Keep it aside.
Sauté diced bell peppers, onion and remove to keep aside.
In the same pan, add finely chopped onions. Sauté well till golden brown.
Add ginger garlic paste and tomato puree. Stir well.
Add red chili powder, turmeric powder, coriander powder, garam masala powder and salt to taste.
Now add sesame and peanut paste.
Add a little water to make semi liquid gravy.
Keep it on slow fire for 5 min, till the oil oozes out from the gravy.
Finally add sautéed diced capsicum, bell peppers and onion and keep it on flame for 5 minutes.
Garnish with chopped coriander and serve hot with steamed rice or Indian breads.

name: Pashtooni Zarda Pulao
ingredients:
750 gm sella rice

200 gm ghee

6 green cardamom
6 black cardamom

2 cinnamon sticks

2 bay leaves
150 gm khoya
4 cloves

5 gm fennel seeds

200 gm sugar

25 gm pistachios

25 gm almonds

50 gm cashews

1 gm saffron

50 gm raisins

1/2 tsp of rose water
instructions:
Soak rice in water for 1 hour and drain. Mix milk, saffron, rose water and sugar in a bowl.
Heat 10-15 cups of water in a pan. Once it comes to boil, add the soaked rice and cook further till the rice is about 80% cooked.
Strain the water from the rice and mix half of ghee. Heat the remaining half of ghee in a pan. Add dry fruits and fry till golden-brown.
Add whole spices and fry for about half a minute. Add the milk mixture and boil. Add the rice and cook on low flame for 10-12 min with cover.

Garnish with khoya, nuts and serve hot.

name: Beerkaya Pachadi
ingredients: A few sprigs of curry leaves
instructions: Peel the ridge gourd, and cut into small pieces.
Heat oil in a pan and fry the pieces with green chilies, garlic and cumin seeds.
Grind the mixture after it cools down along with tamarind paste.
Temper some curry leaves with mustard and urad dal and add it to the mixture before you serve.

name: Peerkangai Kootu
ingredients: 250 gm ridge gourd, peeled and chopped
A few sprigs of curry leaves
instructions: Boil the ridge gourd separately in a small quantity of water with turmeric and salt.
Pressure cook the dal separately.
Fry red chillies and urad dal in coconut oil (small quantity) till they turn golden brown.
Add the coconut, pepper, jeera and curry leaves and stir fry. Cool it down and grind it to a coarse paste.
Bring all the ingredients together and stir fry (add water if required).
Temper the mustard, urad dal, asafoetida and curry leaves in coconut oil and add it to the mixture.

name: Vermicelli Upma
instructions: Heat a wok or a kadai and roast the vermicelli for 3-4 minutes until slightly golden. Transfer to a plate and keep aside.
Heat oil in the same kadai and add urad dal, mustard and cumin seeds. Let them crackle for a minute and add the chillies and curry leaves. Saute for 1-2 minutes and add the onions. Mix well.
Add turmeric powder and salt and saute for 1-2 minutes. Then add the vegetables and stir well. Allow them to cook for 3-4 minutes.

Add the tomato puree and 2 1/2 cups of water, and bring to a rolling boil. Add the vermicelli and mix well. Cover the kadai with a lid and let it cook for 5-6 minutes or until the vermicelli is cooked and the water is dried up.
Check seasoning. Transfer to a serving bowl and finish with roasted peanuts on top and a fresh green chilli. Serve immediately.

name: Chocolate Cake in a Pressure Cooker
instructions: In a mixing bowl, sift the flour, cocoa powder and baking powder.
Add in the butter, sugar, salt, water and vanilla, and beat the ingredients using a whisk.
Add the eggs and beat the batter until smooth.
Transfer into the baking tin.
Heat the pressure cooker, covered with the lid but without the pressure, for 3-4 minutes on high heat, then place the cake tin in the empty cooker (do not add water in the cooker).
Close the lid (without the pressure), lower the flame and let it cook until done (about 30 minutes).

name: Honey Chilli Potatoes
instructions: For the potatoes:
In a bowl, add cornflour or maida, salt and red chilli powder.
Add the sliced potatoes and mix well until the potatoes are coated.
Heat oil in a wok and deep fry the potatoes until golden. Keep aside.
For the Base:
In a wok, add oil, garlic paste and spring onions. Saute on high heat for 1 minute.
Add capsicum, honey, salt, soya sauce, chilli sauce. Saute for 2-3 minutes.
Add the deep-fried potatoes and sesame seeds. Mix well and serve hot.

name: Vegetable Momos
instructions: Mix the maida, salt and baking powder and knead to a stiff dough with water.
Heat oil and add the onion and garlic.
Saute over high heat and add the carrot and cabbage. Turn around over high heat till glossy.
Take it off the heat and mix in the Soya sauce, salt, vinegar and black pepper.
Roll the dough thin (translucent) and cut into 4"-5" rounds.
Take a round, wet edges and place some filling in the center.
Bring edges together to cover the filling. Twist to seal and fill the rest in the same way.
Steam for about 10 minutes and serve with soya sauce and chilli sauce.

name: Chole Bhature
ingredients: 1 tsp whole pepper corns (sabut kali mirch)
1 green chili (chopped)                      1 tea bag                                                1 Tbsp butter
1/2 tsp yeast, dissolved for 10 minutes in luke warm water
instructions: For chole:
In a pan add oil, bay leaf, cinnamon, cumin seeds, cloves, whole pepper corns, green and black cardamom.
After it gets brown add chopped onions and saute it.
After sauteing add chopped ginger and garlic.
Then add turmeric, chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, asafoetida, salt and fry well.
For de glazing the pan add little water.
Now add the chole (soaked overnight and pressure cooked) to the masala.
After stirring well add tomatoes, little sugar and salt to the chole (chickpeas)
Now add ajwain, chopped green chilies and water for the base.
To get the color in the chole, add a tea bag to the masala.
Simmer the chole gently for an hour and cover it.
Add lime juice and a dollop of butter to it.
Garnish the chole with coriander and butter.
Serve the chole hot with bhaturas.
For the bhaturas:
Knead the whole wheat flour, maida and salt together with adequate amount of water.
Sprinkle the yeast on top. Leave it for 2-3 hours for the yeast to work.
Divide it into equal portions. Roll out in an oval or round shape.
Deep fry till golden brown, like a puri.
Serve.

name: Quick Chicken Curry
instructions: Heat oil in a pan and sauté the onion paste, garlic & ginger paste till golden brown.
Add tomato puree. When the tomato puree dries up, add coriander powder, cumin powder, garam masala, red chilli powder, turmeric powder and salt. Let the spices cook.
Add chicken pieces into the masala. Stir well and cook till they are golden brown.
Add 1/2 cup of water and stir. Cover with a lid and let it simmer till the chicken is cooked.
Garnish with chopped coriander and serve.

name: Butter Chicken
instructions: For marinating the chicken
In a mixing bowl, mix red chilli powder, ginger garlic paste, salt and curd.
Add the raw chicken pieces to the marinade and mix well. Keep it in the refrigerator overnight or minimum 6 hours.
Roast the marinated chicken in a tandoor or an oven for about 10-12 minutes until it is three-fourth done.
For the chicken gravy
Heat half the quantity of white butter in pan.
Pour in the tomato puree, and saute for 2-3 minutes. Add cumin seeds, sugar, red chilli powder and salt. Mix well.
Add the prepared chicken, white butter, fresh cream, sliced green chillies and crushed fenugreek leaves.  Saute for 3-4 minutes and let the chicken cook.
Cook till chicken is done. Serve hot with rice or naan.

name: Sangri Ki Shikampuri
instructions: Soak Sangri in water for 1 hour.

Heat 10-15 cups of water in a pan. Once it comes to boil, add the soaked rice and cook further till the rice is about 80% cooked.
Strain the water from the rice and mix half of ghee. Heat the remaining half of ghee in a pan. Add dry fruits and fry till golden-brown.
Add whole spices and fry for about half a minute. Add the milk mixture and boil. Add the rice and cook on low flame for 10-12 min with cover.

Garnish with khoya, nuts and serve hot.

name: Beerkaya Pachadi
ingredients: A few sprigs of curry leaves
instructions: Peel the ridge gourd, and cut into small pieces.
Heat oil in a pan and fry the pieces with green chilies, garlic and cumin seeds.
Grind the mixture after it cools down along with tamarind paste.
Temper some curry leaves with mustard and urad dal and add it to the mixture before you serve.

name: Peerkangai Kootu
ingredients: 250 gm ridge gourd, peeled and chopped
A few sprigs of curry leaves
instructions: Boil the ridge gourd separately in a small quantity of water with turmeric and salt.
Pressure cook the dal separately.
Fry red chillies and urad dal in coconut oil (small quantity) till they turn golden brown.
Add the coconut, pepper, jeera and curry leaves and stir fry. Cool it down and grind it to a coarse paste.
Bring all the ingredients together and stir fry (add water if required).
Temper the mustard, urad dal, asafoetida and curry leaves in coconut oil and add it to the mixture.

name: Vermicelli Upma
instructions: Heat a wok or a kadai and roast the vermicelli for 3-4 minutes until slightly golden. Transfer to a plate and keep aside.
Heat oil in the same kadai and add urad dal, mustard and cumin seeds. Let them crackle for a minute and add the chillies and curry leaves. Saute for 1-2 minutes and add the onions. Mix well.
Add turmeric powder and salt and saute for 1-2 minutes. Then add the vegetables and stir well. Allow them to cook for 3-4 minutes.

Add the tomato puree and 2 1/2 cups of water, and bring to a rolling boil. Add the vermicelli and mix well. Cover the kadai with a lid and let it cook for 5-6 minutes or until the vermicelli is cooked and the water is dried up.
Check seasoning. Transfer to a serving bowl and finish with roasted peanuts on top and a fresh green chilli. Serve immediately.

name: Chocolate Cake in a Pressure Cooker
instructions: In a mixing bowl, sift the flour, cocoa powder and baking powder.
Add in the butter, sugar, salt, water and vanilla, and beat the ingredients using a whisk.
Add the eggs and beat the batter until smooth.
Transfer into the baking tin.
Heat the pressure cooker, covered with the lid but without the pressure, for 3-4 minutes on high heat, then place the cake tin in the empty cooker (do not add water in the cooker).
Close the lid (without the pressure), lower the flame and let it cook until done (about 30 minutes).

name: Honey Chilli Potatoes
instructions: For the potatoes:
In a bowl, add cornflour or maida, salt and red chilli powder.
Add the sliced potatoes and mix well until the potatoes are coated.
Heat oil in a wok and deep fry the potatoes until golden. Keep aside.
For the Base:
In a wok, add oil, garlic paste and spring onions. Saute on high heat for 1 minute.
Add capsicum, honey, salt, soya sauce, chilli sauce. Saute for 2-3 minutes.
Add the deep-fried potatoes and sesame seeds. Mix well and serve hot.

name: Vegetable Momos
instructions: Mix the maida, salt and baking powder and knead to a stiff dough with water.
Heat oil and add the onion and garlic.
Saute over high heat and add the carrot and cabbage. Turn around over high heat till glossy.
Take it off the heat and mix in the Soya sauce, salt, vinegar and black pepper.
Roll the dough thin (translucent) and cut into 4"-5" rounds.
Take a round, wet edges and place some filling in the center.
Bring edges together to cover the filling. Twist to seal and fill the rest in the same way.
Steam for about 10 minutes and serve with soya sauce and chilli sauce.

name: Chole Bhature
ingredients: 1 tsp whole pepper corns (sabut kali mirch)
1 green chili (chopped)                      1 tea bag                                                1 Tbsp butter
1/2 tsp yeast, dissolved for 10 minutes in luke warm water
instructions: For chole:
In a pan add oil, bay leaf, cinnamon, cumin seeds, cloves, whole pepper corns, green and black cardamom.
After it gets brown add chopped onions and saute it.
After sauteing add chopped ginger and garlic.
Then add turmeric, chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, asafoetida, salt and fry well.
For de glazing the pan add little water.
Now add the chole (soaked overnight and pressure cooked) to the masala.
After stirring well add tomatoes, little sugar and salt to the chole (chickpeas)
Now add ajwain, chopped green chilies and water for the base.
To get the color in the chole, add a tea bag to the masala.
Simmer the chole gently for an hour and cover it.
Add lime juice and a dollop of butter to it.
Garnish the chole with coriander and butter.
Serve the chole hot with bhaturas.
For the bhaturas:
Knead the whole wheat flour, maida and salt together with adequate amount of water.
Sprinkle the yeast on top. Leave it for 2-3 hours for the yeast to work.
Divide it into equal portions. Roll out in an oval or round shape.
Deep fry till golden brown, like a puri.
Serve.

name: Quick Chicken Curry
instructions: Heat oil in a pan and sauté the onion paste, garlic & ginger paste till golden brown.
Add tomato puree. When the tomato puree dries up, add coriander powder, cumin powder, garam masala, red chilli powder, turmeric powder and salt. Let the spices cook.
Add chicken pieces into the masala. Stir well and cook till they are golden brown.
Add 1/2 cup of water and stir. Cover with a lid and let it simmer till the chicken is cooked.
Garnish with chopped coriander and serve.

name: Butter Chicken
instructions: For marinating the chicken
In a mixing bowl, mix red chilli powder, ginger garlic paste, salt and curd.
Add the raw chicken pieces to the marinade and mix well. Keep it in the refrigerator overnight or minimum 6 hours.
Roast the marinated chicken in a tandoor or an oven for about 10-12 minutes until it is three-fourth done.
For the chicken gravy
Heat half the quantity of white butter in pan.
Pour in the tomato puree, and saute for 2-3 minutes. Add cumin seeds, sugar, red chilli powder and salt. Mix well.
Add the prepared chicken, white butter, fresh cream, sliced green chillies and crushed fenugreek leaves.  Saute for 3-4 minutes and let the chicken cook.
Cook till chicken is done. Serve hot with rice or naan.

name: Bhindi Aam Singhara
instructions: Make together churan, black salt, salt, turmeric powder & red chilli powder.
Cut the crown of bhindi, slit it from the centre & stuff it with the churan mixture.
Fry it in mustard oil along with a slit green chilli in a pan.
Once cooked, stack it in a pile on a plate.
Fry chopped onions, raw mango & singhara in oil along with heeng, some salt & turmeric powder.
Once cooked, add it on top of bhindi.
Garnish with coriander leaves.

name: Mixed Salad With Lotus Root
instructions: Clean and wash lettuce, dice it.
Soak lotus root and pumpkin in vinegar.
Mix all ingredients in a bowl, add lemongrass sauce.
Portion in a salad bowl and garnish with pomelo and pomegranate.

name: Fried Turnip Cake with Vegetables
instructions: Peel carrots and radish. Cut them into thick juliennes and blanch them till soft.
Soak shiitake mushrooms in hot water for at least 2-3 hours. Squeeze out the water before cutting them.
Cut the shiitake mushrooms into dices and toss them in a hot wok for 2 minutes.
Mix rice flour, potato starch, wheat starch, salt, sugar and water (room temperature, 675 ml) together till it becomes smooth and a light batter.
Add blanched radish and carrots, Add tossed shiitake mushrooms and mix well.
Add hot water (preferably boiling) to this mixture and mix well.

( Note - When you add hot water to starch all the molecule content present in the starch starts to solidify, making it thick and tough to mix. So ensure you add hot water gradually to avoid lump formation).
Oil the surface of the cake tin and line the base of the tin with butter paper to prevent the cake from sticking.
Add this mixture in the cake tin (preferably, square shaped and about 2 inch in height) and steam it for 50-60 minutes.
Once cooked allow it cool for 2-3 hours and brush oil over the surface when cooled. Cover and cool it in a refrigerator overnight.
De-mould the cake and remove the butter paper.
11.Cut into small squares about 1cm thick and fry them till golden.
Make a mixture of fried garlic (finely chopped), fried shallots (finely chopped), chopped spring onions and chili oil.
Arrange it into a pyramid, spoon the fried garlic mixture at the base, place fried turnip cake and repeat till the top of the pyramid. Garnish with finely chopped bird's eye chilies and serve!

name: Foxtail Millet Porridge
instructions: Soak the foxtail millet in water for half an hour
Drain the water.
Add the foxtail to the milk and cook it on a medium heat for 5 minutes.
Once cooked take off heat and add figs, banana, cashew nuts, amarnath and lotus seeds.

name: Sauteed Broccoli & Almonds
instructions: Remove the stalk and cut broccoli into florets.
Parboil the broccoli for two minutes.
In a large pan, toast almonds until golden, about 3 minutes then remove them from the pan.
Add butter to the pan and to it add garlic and sliced stalks. Sauté, until garlic turns golden and stalks start to brown.
Add the florets and continue cooking another 2 minutes.
Cover the pan and cook broccoli until crisp tender.
Season with salt, stir in toasted almonds and serve.

name: Three Style Mushroom Cheung Fun
instructions: Par boil all mushrooms and drain the water.
Stir fry to cook the par boiled mushrooms in a wok, add salt to taste.
Spread the cheung fun mix batter on the flat steamer to cook the batter.
Spread the mushroom filling and roll the Cheung Fun mix batter sheet over the mushroom filling.
Remove from steamer and serve with light warm soya sauce.

name: Roasted Carrot, Rosemary, White Bean Hummus
ingredients: ¼ cup of olive oil, plus extra for topping
instructions: Oil the carrots and roast them in the oven for 15 minutes.
In a food processer or blender, mix the white beans and garlic, and pulse until smooth. You can add a little water, if you find the mixture a little dry.
Add the carrots, cumin powder, red chilli powder, olive oil and salt, and blend again until smooth.
Transfer to a bowl, and add the lemon juice. Mix well and check seasoning.
Finish with a drizzling of olive oil, a sprinkling of red chilli powder and rosemary sprigs on top. Serve with pita breads.

name: Beetroot Hummus
ingredients: ¼ cup of olive oil, plus extra for topping
instructions: Method
Oil and roast the beetroot on the stove or in an oven for 10 minutes. Let it cool. Then chop it into smaller pieces.
In a pan, roast the sesame seeds until aromatic. Allow to cool and then ground into a powder.
In a food processer or blender, mix chickpeas and garlic, and pulse until smooth. You can add a little water, if you find the mixture a little dry.
Add the beetroot, sesame powder, curd, olive oil, cumin powder and salt, and blend again until smooth.
Transfer to a bowl, and add the lemon juice. Mix well and check seasoning. Finish with a drizzling of olive oil and fresh coriander leaves on top. Serve with pita breads.

name: Raw Papaya Kebabs with Aloo Bhukhara Chutney
instructions: Grate peeled raw papaya & potatoes.
Add salt, turmeric powder, red chilli powder and mix well.
Keep this aside for 10 minutes after which squeeze out all the water.
Now, add chopped ginger, green chillies, coarsely pounded roasted cumin seeds, coriander seeds, besan to it.
Mix well, roll into balls.
Add ghee in a pan, allow to heat properly.
Now fry kebabs till golden brown and caramelized on both sides.
For chutney
Cut plums, add sugar, star anise & let it sweat on a low flame, covered with a lid.
After its cooked, cool it down & add some black salt & pepper powder to it.
Let it cool down and serve with kebabs.

name: Masala Papad Bruschetta
instructions: Cut bread loaf into slices & toast it in butter.
Add a mixture of chopped onion, tomatoes, coriander leaves, green chillies, chaat masala, lemon juice & olive oil on the toast.
Sprinkle some crushed roasted papad over it.
Serve

name: Dry Mango Kuzhambu
instructions: Soak tamarind in water.
Dry roast all the ingredients given in the to roast and grind table.Be careful not to burn them.Saute continuosly. Cool and put in a blender. Grind coarsely.
Put the dried mango in water and boil it till they become soft. It should be soft and tender like this.
Meanwhile take out the tamarind extract,put it in a heavy bottomed pan and add salt,asafoetida and sambhar powder to it.Let it boil till the raw smell goes away.
Now add boiled mango pieces.
Add the grounded powder and curry leaves and let it simmer for sometime.
Once thickened temper with some oil, mustard seeds, urad dal and curry leaves. Serve hot with rice.
Notes:
- Soak tamarind the recommended quantity as the mangoes are also sour. - You can add add more pepper if you want it spicier.- If you don't have dried mango use fresh mango.

name: Eggplant Chokha Namak Para
instructions: Apply oil on to eggplants, tomatoes, onion & potato.
Roast all at 180˚ C.
Peel and smash into a nice mixture.
To this, add chopped chillies, coriander leaves, mustard oil & salt, mix well.
Knead a dough mixing together maida, ajwain, salt & olive oil.
Roll it out into a big roti & bake at 170˚ C for 15 minutes.
Once baked, break it into triangular pieces & serve it with the mashed vegetables dip.

name: Quinoa & Jamun Salad
instructions: Boil quinoa on low flame & cool it down.
Mix it with chopped jamuns, cucumber, tomatoes & spring onions.
Add some lemon juice & crushed jamuns to it.
Add olive oil, salt & pepper powder.
Mix well & serve it on salad leaves.

name: Qabooli
instructions: Boil some water with green cardamom, cinnamon sticks, cloves, oil & salt.
Add soaked rice to it.

Take soaked chana dal, yogurt, pepper corns, green & black cardamoms, cinnamon stickcloves, shahi jeera, ginger-garlic paste, green chillies, mint leaves, turmeric powder, red chilli powder & mix well.
In another pan make layers of boiled rice & channa dal mixture.
Add desi ghee & let it cook.
Serve it in a plate, garnished with mint leaves.

name: Curried Hummus with Avocado Rolls
instructions: Blend boiled chickpeas along with garlic cloves, tahini, lemon juice, & curry powder.
Knead a dough of wheat flour, salt, jeera & dry methi leaves & make dough balls.
Roll dough balls gently & cook with desi ghee.
Spread hummus on rotis & add chopped red cabbage, cucumber, onion, tomatoes & avocado dressed with salt, pepper powder, lemon juice & olive oil.
Serve it with some hummus drizzled with olive oil & a pinch of red chilli powder

name: Aamras ke Aloo
instructions: Heat oil in a pan.
Add dry red chilli, mustard seeds, jeera, methi seeds, heeng & water.
Add chopped ginger, garlic.
Add raw mangoes followed by turmeric powder, red chilli powder & dhaniya powder.
Now, add baby potatoes, salt, black salt & toss till it absorbs all the masala.
Add mango juice & let it cook.
Serve hot.

name: Bharwan Tinda with Tomato Sauce
ingredients: 1 tsp jeera1 tsp saunf1 tsp mustard seeds
instructions: Peel apple gourds.
In a bowl, add pounded jeera, saunf, mustard seeds, turmeric powder, kasuri methipowder, coriander powder, aamchur powder, red chilli powder, salt & black salt, mix well.
In another bowl, pour some mustard oil, add the mixed masala, chopped garlic & mix well.
Make incisions in apple gourd & fill it with the masala.
Roast it in oven at 170˚c for 12 minutes.
Remove the tray from the oven, take a brush & paste the tinda with the oil from the tray.
Add tomato puree & let it spread across the tray.
Put it back in the oven to  roast at 190˚c.
Once roasted garnish with coriander leaves.

name: Tukkad Roti
instructions: Knead a dough using corn flour, wheat flour, ajwain & salt.
Make dough balls.
Roll dough balls gently into small sizes, sprinkle some chopped onion, tomatoes & green chillies.
Roll it again to embed it into the roti.
Fry it in desi ghee.
Serve

name: Chocolate Cake in a Pressure Cooker
instructions: In a mixing bowl, sift the flour, cocoa powder and baking powder.
Add in the butter, sugar, salt, water and vanilla, and beat the ingredients using a whisk.
Add the eggs and beat the batter until smooth.
Transfer into the baking tin.
Heat the pressure cooker, covered with the lid but without the pressure, for 3-4 minutes on high heat, then place the cake tin in the empty cooker (do not add water in the cooker).
Close the lid (without the pressure), lower the flame and let it cook until done (about 30 minutes).

instructions: For the potatoes:
In a bowl, add cornflour or maida, salt and red chilli powder.
Add the sliced potatoes and mix well until the potatoes are coated.
Heat oil in a wok and deep fry the potatoes until golden. Keep aside.
For the Base:
In a wok, add oil, garlic paste and spring onions. Saute on high heat for 1 minute.
Add capsicum, honey, salt, soya sauce, chilli sauce. Saute for 2-3 minutes.
Add the deep-fried potatoes and sesame seeds. Mix well and serve hot.

name: Vegetable Momos
instructions: Mix the maida, salt and baking powder and knead to a stiff dough with water.
Heat oil and add the onion and garlic.
Saute over high heat and add the carrot and cabbage. Turn around over high heat till glossy.
Take it off the heat and mix in the Soya sauce, salt, vinegar and black pepper.
Roll the dough thin (translucent) and cut into 4"-5" rounds.
Take a round, wet edges and place some filling in the center.
Bring edges together to cover the filling. Twist to seal and fill the rest in the same way.
Steam for about 10 minutes and serve with soya sauce and chilli sauce.

1 green chili (chopped)                      1 tea bag                                                1 Tbsp butter
1/2 tsp yeast, dissolved for 10 minutes in luke warm water
instructions: For chole:
In a pan add oil, bay leaf, cinnamon, cumin seeds, cloves, whole pepper corns, green and black cardamom.
After it gets brown add chopped onions and saute it.
After sauteing add chopped ginger and garlic.
Then add turmeric, chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, asafoetida, salt and fry well.
For de glazing the pan add little water.
Now add the chole (soaked overnight and pressure cooked) to the masala.
After stirring well add tomatoes, little sugar and salt to the chole (chickpeas)
Now add ajwain, chopped green chilies and water for the base.
To get the color in the chole, add a tea bag to the masala.
Simmer the chole gently for an hour and cover it.
Add lime juice and a dollop of butter to it.
Garnish the chole with coriander and butter.
Serve the chole hot with bhaturas.

Knead the whole wheat flour, maida and salt together with adequate amount of water.
Sprinkle the yeast on top. Leave it for 2-3 hours for the yeast to work.
Divide it into equal portions. Roll out in an oval or round shape.
Deep fry till golden brown, like a puri.
Serve.

name: Quick Chicken Curry
instructions: Heat oil in a pan and sauté the onion paste, garlic & ginger paste till golden brown.
Add tomato puree. When the tomato puree dries up, add coriander powder, cumin powder, garam masala, red chilli powder, turmeric powder and salt. Let the spices cook.
Add chicken pieces into the masala. Stir well and cook till they are golden brown.
Add 1/2 cup of water and stir. Cover with a lid and let it simmer till the chicken is cooked.
Garnish with chopped coriander and serve.

name: Butter Chicken
instructions: For marinating the chicken
In a mixing bowl, mix red chilli powder, ginger garlic paste, salt and curd.
Add the raw chicken pieces to the marinade and mix well. Keep it in the refrigerator overnight or minimum 6 hours.
Roast the marinated chicken in a tandoor or an oven for about 10-12 minutes until it is three-fourth done.
For the chicken gravy
Heat half the quantity of white butter in pan.
Pour in the tomato puree, and saute for 2-3 minutes. Add cumin seeds, sugar, red chilli powder and salt. Mix well.
Add the prepared chicken, white butter, fresh cream, sliced green chillies and crushed fenugreek leaves.  Saute for 3-4 minutes and let the chicken cook.
Cook till chicken is done. Serve hot with rice or naan.

name: Indian Summer Melon Salad
instructions: Take a bowl of yogurt & add honey, pepper powder, chopped basil leaves, salt & mix well.
Pour it on a platter of chopped cantaloupe, honeydew, sun melon & watermelon.
Pour some more honey & sprinkle some pepper powder over the platter.
Garnish with mint leaves.

name: Grilled Peach and Papaya Salad with Amaranth Granola
instructions: For the dressing:
Make a puree of the papaya.
Add White Balsamic Vinegar to the puree.
Adjust the acidity by adding the sugar.
Blitz in a blender at slow speed along with olive oil till an emulsion is formed.
Set aside in a refrigerator.
For the amaranth granola:
Combine all the ingredients and bake in an oven at 140 degrees for 15 minutes.
Once cooked take out and cool.
To assemble the salad:
In a bowl, add the leaves and add a tbsp. of the dressing. Mix well and put on the base of the serving dish.
Combine the rest of the ingredients with 2 Tbsp of dressing and place on top of the leaves.
Break the granola into little pieces and put on top of the salad.

name: Sattu Parantha
instructions: Knead a dough combining wheat flour, sprouted wheat, & Oats.
For stuffing, take sattu in a bowl & add chopped onions, green chilli, garlic, kalaunji, ajwain, achari paste, salt & olive oil, mix well.
Shape some dough into small cups, fill with sattu mixture, close & shape into dough balls.
Roll out gently.
Cook on tawa with ghee,
Serve hot.

name: Creamy Upma with Asparagus
instructions: Add boiling water to a pan.
Add salt & peeled asparagus.
Take the asparagus out & leave it in an Ice bath.
Add butter to a pan & sauté button mushrooms, chopped onions, garlic, green chillies & semolina.
Add milk & pepper powder & let it simmer.
Take butter in another pan & sauté crushed almonds in it & keep it aside.
Add butter again to the same pan & sauté asparagus with salt & pepper powder.
Plate it.
Add milk to upma once again & put it over ssparagus.
Garnish with crushed almonds.

name: Peach & Apricot Kheer (My Yellow Table)
instructions: Simmer milk in a pan until it thickens.
Add vanilla pod, & apricots.
Once the milk begins to boil, add soaked rice.
Allow it to cook. Add fresh chopped peaches in a bowl.
Add kheer to it & garnish with crushed almonds & pistachios

name: Bhuna Mushroom (My Yellow Table)
instructions: Boil shiitake mushrooms.
Heat oil in a pan.
Add shahi jeera, chopped onion, ginger, garlic & green chillies and butter.
Add button mushrooms & sliced shiitake mushrooms.
Now, add turmeric powder, red chilli powder, dhaniya powder, salt & chopped tomatoes.
Add water used to boil shiitake mushrooms & cashew paste.
Add black & white fungus

name: Ratatouille Nicoise
instructions: Wash eggplants, zucchinis and paprika.
Cut them in dices.
Wash and peel tomatoes, dice them.  Sauté eggplant in olive oil for 3 to 4 minutes and remove them.

Do the same with the zucchinis, but add onions and paprika to them.  Put all the veggies back to the fryer and tomatoes, garlic, basil and thyme. Add two tablespoons of olive oil to the dish. Salt and pepper. stir.  Cook with the lid on, cook gently on heat for 10 t0 12 min,. Stir during cooking.
For the last 3  minutes remove the lid, so that the remaining liquid would evaporate.
Once cooked check for seasoning and serve with rice or pasta

name: Barley and Spinach Risotto
instructions: Place stock and 3 cups of cold water in a large saucepan over medium heat.
Cook for 10 minutes or until the mixture starts to simmer.
Reduce heat to low to keep hot.
Heat butter and half the oil in a large, heavy-based saucepan over medium heat.
Add onion and garlic.
Cook, stirring, for 5 minutes or until onion has softened.
Add barley.
Stir to combine.
Reduce heat to low.
Add 1/2 cup stock mixture to barley mixture.
Cook, stirring, until stock has absorbed.
Repeat with remaining stock, 1/2 cup at a time, until all liquid is absorbed and barley is tender and creamy
Stir lemon rind into barley and add spinach, check for seasoning.
Cook for 1 to 2 minutes or until heated thoroughly.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve risotto topped with lemon rind

name: Tomato Pulao (My Yellow Table)
instructions: Soak rice.
Heat oil in a pan, add jeera,  peppercorns, heeng, chopped onion, garlic & green chillies.
Let it brown.
Now, add tomatoes & cook it till it wilts.
Add soaked rice & water.
Close lid once water has reduced & it just covers the rice.
Let it cook on low flame.
Serve hot, garnished with mint leaves.

name: Green Moong Dal (My Yellow Table)
ingredients: 250 gms green moong dal2 green chillies
instructions: Boil green moong dal in a pan.
Add green chillies, ginger, ghee, browned onions & let it boil.
Add turmeric powder & butter.
In a pan, saute dry red chillies, chopped garlic & clove in ghee.
Pour this into the dal & let it simmer & reduce to a thick consistency.
Let it boil.
Pour in a bowl & garnish with coriander leaves & browned onions.

name: Asparagus & Coconut Soup (My Yellow Table)
instructions: Chop asparagus heads & keep them aside.
Chop the remaining asparagus.
Add butter & oil to pan.
Now, sauté chopped onions, garlic, ginger, pepper corns, bay leaf, mustard seeds, green chillies, curry leaves & asparagus in it.
Add maida & water.
Allow it to cook.
Put the mixture into a blender & give it a whiz with ice cubes & spinach.
Strain it in a pan & give it a quick boil.
Add salt, coconut milk, lemon juice & chopped asparagus heads to the soup.
Add soup to a plate.
Serve hot, garnished with mint leaves.

name: Crema Di Cannellini Con Mescolare Funghi (Mushroom Soup)
ingredients: Dry morel mushrooms soaked and sliced - 20 gms
Dry porcini mushrooms soaked and sliced - 20 gms
Dry shiitake mushrooms soaked and sliced - 20 gms
instructions: In a sauce pan, heat oil, cook onions and celery for 5 to 8 min, now add garlic and cook for another 1 min, continually stirring,
Add beans, stock, pepper and thyme and bring to boil, reduce heat and the simmer for 30 minutes
Put off the flame and blend to a smooth consistency and check for seasoning
Now toss mushrooms in a tablespoon of olive oil and check for seasoning
Serve soup hot with tossed mushroom on top

name: Khameeri Roti (My Yellow Table)
instructions: Mix dry yeast, sugar & flour to water. leave aside.
Knead a dough of flour, milk & yeast mixture.
Add sugar & salt to taste.
Knead in a little oil & leave aside to rise.
Now, make small dough balls & roll out into rough rectangles.
Sprinkle kalonji, melon seeds & sesame seeds over it & roll out once more to embed seeds in it.
Cook over tava without any oil,
Serve hot.

name: Raw Mango & Papaya Salad (My Yellow Table)
instructions: Peel raw papaya, mangoes, & carrots,
Chop and shred these in a food processor.
Make a dressing of crushed jaggery, lemon juice, crushed garlic, chopped red chilli & olive oil.
Add some halved cherry tomatoes, roasted peanuts & roughly chopped fresh coriander to the salad.
Pour the dressing atop & serve garnished with toasted sesame seeds.

name: Dal Makhni (My Yellow Table)
instructions: Rinse maa ki dal and boil till soft & the skin falls off.
Add salt, red chilli powder, tomato puree & butter.
Allow to cook. Add kasuri methi powder & cream.
Stir well & serve hot.

name: Tomato & Pickled Beet Salad (My Yellow Table)
instructions: In a pan, heat white vinegar, salt & sugar with some water, & add chopped beetroot.
Cook so that they absorb the flavours, but do  not lose their crunch.
Remove from the pan and put into an ice bath.
Chop tomatoes in thin rounds &  arrange in a circle on a plate.
Add another circular layer with beetroot.
To finish off, heap halved cherry tomatoes  in the middle of the arrangement.
Pour a dressing made from garlic cloves, salt , black pepper, balsamic vinegar & olive oil over the salad.
Serve.

name: Pudina Lachcha Parantha (My Yellow Table)
instructions: Knead a dough combining wheat flour, maida, salt & ghee.
Add black salt, red chilli powder, chaat masala to pudina powder.
Grind green chillies to a paste & mix it into the dough.
Make dough balls & roll out into long strips of the same length.
Add ghee, dust with flour, sprinkle pudina mixture over strips.
Overlay them by crossing it with each other.
Pat into a square & roll out gently again.
Fry with ghee

name: White Sauce Pasta
instructions: Boil the pasta as per the instructions printed on the packet. Then strain pasta and let it cool.
Heat a pan and pour olive oil on it till it's slightly warm. Add chopped garlic and vegetables and saute for a minute.
Add fresh cream, salt and pepper and then toss in the fettuccine pasta. Cook for about two minutes.
Transfer into a serving dish and garnish with Parmesan cheese and chopped parsley.
Tip:
You can use cheddar cheese instead of Parmesan cheese.

name: Chocolate Cake in a Pressure Cooker
instructions: In a mixing bowl, sift the flour, cocoa powder and baking powder.
Add in the butter, sugar, salt, water and vanilla, and beat the ingredients using a whisk.
Add the eggs and beat the batter until smooth.
Transfer into the baking tin.
Heat the pressure cooker, covered with the lid but without the pressure, for 3-4 minutes on high heat, then place the cake tin in the empty cooker (do not add water in the cooker).
Close the lid (without the pressure), lower the flame and let it cook until done (about 30 minutes).

name: Honey Chilli Potatoes
instructions: For the potatoes:
In a bowl, add cornflour or maida, salt and red chilli powder.
Add the sliced potatoes and mix well until the potatoes are coated.
Heat oil in a wok and deep fry the potatoes until golden. Keep aside.
For the Base:
In a wok, add oil, garlic paste and spring onions. Saute on high heat for 1 minute.
Add capsicum, honey, salt, soya sauce, chilli sauce. Saute for 2-3 minutes.
Add the deep-fried potatoes and sesame seeds. Mix well and serve hot.

name: Vegetable Momos
instructions: Mix the maida, salt and baking powder and knead to a stiff dough with water.
Heat oil and add the onion and garlic.
Saute over high heat and add the carrot and cabbage. Turn around over high heat till glossy.
Take it off the heat and mix in the Soya sauce, salt, vinegar and black pepper.
Roll the dough thin (translucent) and cut into 4"-5" rounds.
Take a round, wet edges and place some filling in the center.
Bring edges together to cover the filling. Twist to seal and fill the rest in the same way.
Steam for about 10 minutes and serve with soya sauce and chilli sauce.

name: Chole Bhature
ingredients: 1 tsp whole pepper corns (sabut kali mirch)
1 green chili (chopped)                      1 tea bag                                                1 Tbsp butter
1/2 tsp yeast, dissolved for 10 minutes in luke warm water
instructions: For chole:
In a pan add oil, bay leaf, cinnamon, cumin seeds, cloves, whole pepper corns, green and black cardamom.
After it gets brown add chopped onions and saute it.
After sauteing add chopped ginger and garlic.
Then add turmeric, chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, asafoetida, salt and fry well.
For de glazing the pan add little water.
Now add the chole (soaked overnight and pressure cooked) to the masala.
After stirring well add tomatoes, little sugar and salt to the chole (chickpeas)
Now add ajwain, chopped green chilies and water for the base.
To get the color in the chole, add a tea bag to the masala.
Simmer the chole gently for an hour and cover it.
Add lime juice and a dollop of butter to it.
Garnish the chole with coriander and butter.
Serve the chole hot with bhaturas.
For the bhaturas:
Knead the whole wheat flour, maida and salt together with adequate amount of water.
Sprinkle the yeast on top. Leave it for 2-3 hours for the yeast to work.
Divide it into equal portions. Roll out in an oval or round shape.
Deep fry till golden brown, like a puri.
Serve.

name: Quick Chicken Curry
instructions: Heat oil in a pan and sauté the onion paste, garlic & ginger paste till golden brown.
Add tomato puree. When the tomato puree dries up, add coriander powder, cumin powder, garam masala, red chilli powder, turmeric powder and salt. Let the spices cook.
Add chicken pieces into the masala. Stir well and cook till they are golden brown.
Add 1/2 cup of water and stir. Cover with a lid and let it simmer till the chicken is cooked.
Garnish with chopped coriander and serve.

name: Butter Chicken
instructions: For marinating the chicken
In a mixing bowl, mix red chilli powder, ginger garlic paste, salt and curd.
Add the raw chicken pieces to the marinade and mix well. Keep it in the refrigerator overnight or minimum 6 hours.
Roast the marinated chicken in a tandoor or an oven for about 10-12 minutes until it is three-fourth done.
For the chicken gravy
Heat half the quantity of white butter in pan.
Pour in the tomato puree, and saute for 2-3 minutes. Add cumin seeds, sugar, red chilli powder and salt. Mix well.
Add the prepared chicken, white butter, fresh cream, sliced green chillies and crushed fenugreek leaves.  Saute for 3-4 minutes and let the chicken cook.
Cook till chicken is done. Serve hot with rice or naan.

name: Kathal Biryani (My Yellow Table)
instructions: Soak rice for at least 40 minutes.
Chop raw jack fruit & add salt, red chilli powder, turmeric powder, dhaniya powder and besan mix well.
Sprinkle some water & deep fry it,
Take yogurt in a bowl,
Add red chilli powder, turmeric powder, ginger & garlic paste, cinnamon sticks, bay leaf, cloves, green cardamom, slit green chillies, mint leaves, salt & mix well.
Add fried jackfruit to it & marinate.
Par boil rice with salt, green cardamom & oil.
Strain the rice & layer the biryani.
Add saffron, oil & drained rice water to it & cook for 10 minutes.For Raita.
Add browned garlic, red chilli powder & roasted cumin to yogurt & mix well.

name: Tomato Salad (My Yellow Table)
instructions: Heat oil in a pan and saute together jeera, sliced onions, balsamic vinegar and cherry tomatoes.
Add Salt and coriander and toss in the tomatoes.
Serve!

name: Methi Parantha (My Yellow Table)
instructions: Knead a dough using wheat flour, Jeera, salt and kasuri methi.
Grind together green chillies, garlic & green onion leaves to a paste.
Add this to the dough & knead well.
Make dough balls, roll out into paranthas & shallow fry with some desi Ghee.

name: Bhuna Pyaaz (My Yellow Table)
instructions: Make  5-6 Incisions in a peeled Onion.
Stuff the incisions with a paste made of turmeric powder, jeera powder, dhaniya powder, red chilli powder, amchur powder, kasuri methi powder, black salt, salt and mustard oil.
Now, bake these onions at 180℃  for 15 minutes.
Heat oil and add dry red chillies, paanch phoren, chopped onions, garlic to a pan.
Further add turmeric powder, red chilli powder, cardamom powder, water, tomatoes, kasuri methi powder, salt, black pepper and allow it to cook.
Once ready pour it between the baked onions and serve

name: Cheese and Avocado Parantha (My Yellow Table)
instructions: Add together wheat flour, kasuri methi, water, salt, olive oil and work in a dough.
Make small balls.
Stuff them with avocado, mozzarella cheese, pizza seasoning & salt.
Make parathas & fry with ghee

name: Wild Berries and Lavender Kheer
instructions: Take milk in a heavy bottom pan and give it a boil.
Reduce the flame and add rice and sugar.
Keep stirring until the rice gets cooked and milk reduces to half.
Take the pan off the flame and allow the kheer to cool.
Add thandai, lavender essence, whipped cream and fresh fruits to the chilled kheer.
Garnish with fresh lavender flowers, serve.

name: Lehsun Pudina Parantha (My Yellow Table)
instructions: Crush mint leaves, garlic cloves & green chillies.
Knead into a dough along with salt  and water.
Make balls and roll these into rotis using a rolling pin.
Tear the rolled out dough down the middle till halfway,
Take one edge and roll inwards, into a cone.
Stand it up on the base, flatten the cone, roll out again into paranthas
Fry with some ghee and serve.

name: Couscous with Achari Baingan & Yogurt (My Yellow Table)
ingredients: 1 cup of couscous2 cups of boiling water6-7 Brinjals100 gms of achari masala1 Onion6-7 Garlic cloves2 tsp mustard1 tsp paanch phoren1 Tomato1/2 tsp turmeric powder1/2  tsp red chilli powder1/2 tsp coriander powder1 tsp achari paste1 cup yogurtSalt
instructions:
Take couscous in a bowl & add
 boiling water to it. Slit 6-7 brinjals & fill it with achari paste & salt.Heat oil in a pan. Add panch phoron,onions, ginger, garlic, turmeric powder, red chilli powder, coriander powder, tomato, achari paste and water.Add brinjals to it and let it cook.Add crushed garlic cloves and salt to yogurt and mix gently.Add fluffed couscous on the platter with fried brinjals.
Add the remaining masala on it & serve it with garlic yogurt.

name: Dahi ke Kebab (My Yellow Table)
instructions: In a bowl mix hung yoghurt, brown onions, green chillies, onions, ginger, paneer & cheese.
Add bhuna jeera, black salt, salt & coriander.
Make small kebabs and mix it in batter made of maida and bread crumbs.
Keep it in the fridge for 30 minutes.
Deep fry in hot oil and serve.

name: Beetroot Halwa with Mascarpone Cheese (My Yellow Table)
instructions: Grate beetroots and cook them in a hot dry pan along with sugar, vanilla pod, desi ghee, & orange rind.
Once cooked, plate it & garnish with crushed pistachio & Mascarpone cheese.

name: Mushroom Khitchda (My Yellow Table)
instructions: Boil 1 cup of barley,
Chop onions, garlic, green chillies and mushrooms,
Take 100 gms butter in a pan and let it heat.
Add cumin, onions, garlic & green chillies,
Add button mushrooms followed by shiitake mushrooms,
Add some shiitake water, salt and black pepper, let it cook.
Garnish it with Coriander

name: Chenna Bruschetta with Orange Marmalade Chutney (My Yellow Table)
instructions: Bring milk to curdle,
Strain away curdled milk and collect chenna,
Add Cream and mix well.
Add orange marmalade in a pan,
To this, add water, orange juice, orange and lemon juice.
Now, add crushed cumin, black salt, salt and black pepper and allow it to boil.
Cut bread into slices and toast it,
Add olive oil once toasted and rub few pods of Garlic on it,
Add a basil leaf on each toast,
Now, spread over chenna,
Garnish it with orange marmalade.

name: Besan ke Paranthe (My Yellow Table)
ingredients: 1 tsp jeera1 Tbsp dhania1 Tbsp oil
instructions: Make dough of besan, flour, onion, green chillies, chopped ginger, turmeric powder, coriander, jeera, coarsely ground coriander seeds & oil.
Roll it out in paranthas and fry with ghee.

name: Moong Dal Ki Goli
instructions: Method for the goli:
Soak moong dal in enough water for 2 hours. Grind the dal to a coarse texture. Mix well with ginger, garlic, onions, green chillies, garam masala and salt.
Shape into round dumplings and deep fry till well-done. Keep aside. Method for the gravy:
Heat oil in a pan. Add finely chopped ginger and garlic, saute till the raw aroma goes away and till they change colour slightly. Add chopped onions, fry till they turn translucent.
Once done, add the chopped tomatoes, chopped green chilies, turmeric powder and red chilli powder. Fry these together to infuse the flavours into the mixture.
When the gravy is done, add the fried dumplings of moong dal. Season with salt and garnish with coriander leaves.

name: Paneer KundanKaliyan
instructions: Cut cottage cheese or paneer in thin slices. Marinate these with turmeric and chilli powder. Shallow fry.
Heat oil in a pan. Add Kashmiri red chillies, coriander seeds, cloves and cardamoms to hot oil and saute till they change colour slightly.
Add chopped onions till they are translucent. Add chopped tomatoes and dried rose petals. Saute this mixture for a few minutes.

Add yogurt and garam masala. Whisk continuously on low flame so that the yogurt does not curdle. Once done, add shallow fried cottage cheese slices. Season with salt and garnish with coriander leaves.

name: Shorba
instructions: Soak moong dal and tur dal (pigeon pea) in water for a couple of hours. After they have been soaked well, pressure cook them with spinach leaves in 4 cups of water. Make a paste and leave aside.

Heat oil in a pan. Once done, add cumin seeds till they splutter. Then add finely chopped ginger and garlic. Saute them till the raw aroma goes away. When they are slightly browned, add garam masala, turmeric powder, chopped chillies and a pinch of asafoetida.
Fry this mixture on low flame and then add the dal and spinach paste. You can add some water to adjust the consistency.
Add thick cream to the simmering dal, season with salt and lemon juice.

name: Bhutte ka Shorba (My Yellow Table)
instructions: Heat oil, add butter, jeera, turmeric powder, chopped onion, chillies, garlic and chopped ginger.
Now, add  sweet corn, water, salt and bring to boil.
Add the mixture to a food processor & puree it.
Pour it back into the pan, add some water, lemon juice, chaat masala & mix.
Serve it in a bowl.

name: Pindi Chole (My Yellow Table)
instructions: Soak chole overnight,
Take a clean cloth and put tea leaves, cinnamon, cloves, green & black cardamom, bay leaves in it and make a bundle (potli)  out of it.
In a pan put soaked chole along with the bundles spices, salt add water and allow this to boil for at least an hour.
Once boiled, add turmeric powder, dhania powder, jeera powder, red chilli powder, pomegranate powder, dried mango powder & kasuri methi powder and keep aside without mixing or stirring.
Heat oil in a pan, saute ajwain, ginger, garlic & green chillies,
Now, pour the mixture over chole.
Add water, pinch of black salt, one Tbsp. tamarind water, salt to taste and cook it over low flame.
Once cooked garnish with chopped coriander.

name: Chocolate Cake in a Pressure Cooker
instructions: In a mixing bowl, sift the flour, cocoa powder and baking powder.
Add in the butter, sugar, salt, water and vanilla, and beat the ingredients using a whisk.
Add the eggs and beat the batter until smooth.
Transfer into the baking tin.
Heat the pressure cooker, covered with the lid but without the pressure, for 3-4 minutes on high heat, then place the cake tin in the empty cooker (do not add water in the cooker).
Close the lid (without the pressure), lower the flame and let it cook until done (about 30 minutes).

For the Base:

Add capsicum, honey, salt, soya sauce, chilli sauce. Saute for 2-3 minutes.
Add the deep-fried potatoes and sesame seeds. Mix well and serve hot.

Add tomato puree. When the tomato puree dries up, add coriander powder, cumin powder, garam masala, red chilli powder, turmeric powder and salt. Let the spices cook.
Add chicken pieces into the masala. Stir well and cook till they are golden brown.
Add 1/2 cup of water and stir. Cover with a lid and let it simmer till the chicken is cooked.
Garnish with chopped coriander and serve.

instructions: For marinating the chicken
In a mixing bowl, mix red chilli powder, ginger garlic paste, salt and curd.
Add the raw chicken pieces to the marinade and mix well. Keep it in the refrigerator overnight or minimum 6 hours.
Roast the marinated chicken in a tandoor or an oven for about 10-12 minutes until it is three-fourth done.

Heat half the quantity of white butter in pan.
Pour in the tomato puree, and saute for 2-3 minutes. Add cumin seeds, sugar, red chilli powder and salt. Mix well.
Add the prepared chicken, white butter, fresh cream, sliced green chillies and crushed fenugreek leaves.  Saute for 3-4 minutes and let the chicken cook.
Cook till chicken is done. Serve hot with rice or naan.

name: Som Tum Chae or Raw Papaya Salad
ingredients: 1/4th cup tomato, sliced or cherry tomatoes
instructions: Peel the raw papaya and grate it. Toss all the ingredients together with the grated papaya. Serve it on a bed of cabbage.
Note: You can also use shredded carrots instead of raw papaya.

name: Olive Paratha (My Yellow Table)
instructions: Add together olives, capers, green chillies, garlic, basil, sesame and red chilli flakes to flour,
To this, add water, mix and work into the dough,
Once ready, roll into parathas and fry it with olive oil.

name: Palak Mirchi Kadi (My Yellow Table)
instructions: Add together yogurt, besan, salt, red chilli powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, turmeric, Kasuri Methi powder and ginger-garlic paste.
Now, add water, whisk & allow it to cook on medium flame.
Slit achari chillies and stuff it with a mixture of  mashed potatoes and achaar or pickle masala,
Heat oil in a pan, add methi seeds, dried red chillies, heeng, cumin and coriander seeds,
To this, add stuffed peppers and sauté till done.
Take peppers out and plate them in a casserole.
In the same pan, add chopped spinach, sauté and add in kadhi.
Pour kadhi atop plated peppers and serve.

name: Indian Style Minestrone Soup (My Yellow Table)
instructions: Heat oil and add jeera, bay leaves, onions, garlic cloves & celery,
Sweat onions and garlic,
Now, add chopped potatoes, zucchini, carrot & tomatoes,
Further add basil leaves, black pepper and water; bring to boil,
Garnish with Parmesan and basil leaves,
Serve hot!

name: Raw Mango Pulao (My Yellow Table)
instructions: Heat oil in a pan,
Add dry red chillies, mustard seeds, heeng, curry leaves add green chillies,
Now, add chopped raw mango, let it cook.
Finish by adding boiled rice, salt and sprinkle some water.
Let the rice cook properly, turn off and serve.

name: Compressed Fruit Chaat (My Yellow Table)
instructions: Cut pineapples, Washington apples and watermelon,
Take three different bowls and pour in them pineapple, apple and watermelon juice respectively.
To these bowls, add roasted cumin seeds, chaat masala, black salt and juice of half a lemon each.
Refrigerate for at least three hours,
Take the bowls out of the fridge, cut fruits in smaller pieces, plate them, pour juices atop and garnish with mint leaves.

name: Lentil Coconut Curry (My Yellow Table)
instructions: Soak tuar dal for 15-20 minutes, then let it boil.
Put some coconut oil in pan and let it heat.
Fry together dried red chillies, onions, green chillies, ginger, garlic, mustard seeds, heeng, curry leaves, turmeric, dhania powder.
Now, pour in dal,
To this, add 1/2 cup of water and puree the dal in a mixer grinder.
Add it to pan and bring it to boil again and add 1/2 a cup of coconut milk.
Finish by adding a Tbsp. of tamarind paste.

name: Apple and Walnut Salad (My Yellow Table)
instructions: Cut Washington apples into wedges.
Heat a pan on low flame, add apples, 2-3 tbsp. balsamic vinegar and 2-3 tbsp caster sugar.
Cook till apples absorb vinegar and sugar, leave aside to cool.
Caramelize caster sugar, add walnuts, leave it to cool
Now, in a bowl add 2-3 tbsp balsamic vinegar and chopped basil leaves.
To this, add salt, pepper and olive oil.
Whisk and add 1/2 tbsp curry powder.
Finish by crushing caramelized walnuts atop.
Serve on a bed of lettuce.

name: Chocolate Modak Surprise
instructions: Powder the glucose biscuits well. Mix it with the drinking chocolate powder, milkmaid and four tablespoons of ghee.
Fry the cashews and hazlenuts in 1 tablespoon ghee.
Make a ball of the chocolate mix and while you do so, add one of the dry fruits in the center Complete by giving it the Modak shape. You can use moulds also.
Chef's tip: Roll the modaks in desiccated coconut and serve chilled! It's great to have kids picking out the Modaks and wondering what they'll find in the center each time.

name: Masala Baby Potato Roast
ingredients: 500 g baby potatoes4 Tbsp oil1 tsp cumin seeds/ jeera1/4 tsp asafoetida/ hing1 tsp dry mango powder/ amchoorSalt to taste1 Tbsp lemon juice2 Tbsp fresh coriander, chopped
1 Tbsp coriander seeds3-4 Kashmiri dry red chilies1 tsp black peppercorns/ kali mirch1 tsp fennel seeds/ saunf1 tsp cumin seeds/ jeera
instructions: Par boil the potatoes and peel them. Keep aside.
Dry roast the ingredients for the masala till slightly brown and fragrant. Cool and grind to make a slightly coarse powder. Keep aside.
Heat oil in a pan. When the oil is hot, add cumin seeds and hing. Once the cumin seeds starts to crackle, add potatoes and fry on high heat till slightly browned from all the sides.
Add the ground masala, dry mango powder and salt and fry for 3-4 minutes on low heat.
Sprinkle lemon juice and coriander and mix well.
Serve hot with chapati or paratha.

name: Khada Desi Palak
instructions: Wash and blanch spinach.
In heavy bottom pan, heat canola oil. Temper with cumin seeds and garlic. Let garlic turn golden brown, then add ginger, chillies and spinach.
Quickly toss over high flame so spinach wilts off nicely but does not overcook to lose flavors.
Taste for seasoning before serving.
Garnish with fenugreek leaves (optional).

name: Amchoori Dum Ki Bhindi
instructions: Wash and trim bhindi at both ends, wipe dry and cut slit in center. Set aside.
In heavy bottom pan, heat canola oil, then temper cumin seeds. Add onion, ginger, chilies, turmeric and then yogurt and reduce to pasty texture, stirring continuously.
Add mango powder and coriander leaves. Season and cool.
Pack slit bhindi with mixture and steam with double boil method or idly steamer set up for 8-10 minutes.
Serve hot with roti.

name: Mavinakayi Nellikai Chitranna (Raw Mango & Gooseberry Rice)
ingredients: 1 cup sona masoori Rice  15 gooseberries (amla)1 raw mango 1/4 tsp turmeric powder 10-12 green chillies 15 gms crushed cashews 1 Tbsp channa dal 1 tsp urad dal 1/2 tsp mustard seeds Curry leaves 2 Tbsp oil Salt to taste
instructions: Wash and soak rice for 10 to 15 minutes.
Cook rice in draining method. Let it cool.
Remove seeds from gooseberries and cut them in fine pieces.
Remove the outer skin of mangoes and cut them in fine pieces.
Slit green chillies into two pieces.

Heat oil in a thick bottom pan and crackle mustard seeds. Add Channa dal, urad dal and cashew nuts.Fry until they turn light golden.Add slit green chillies, curry leaves and fry well. Add chopped gooseberries and raw mangoes, fry for 2-3 minutes. Add turmeric powder, salt and mix. Cover and cook on low flame for 6-8 minutes.Let the mixture cool.Add cooked rice to the mashed mixture and mix well.Season according to your taste.

name: Grilled Veggie Quesadilla
instructions: For the Corn Tortilla:
Mix the flours, salt & oil to make a dough. Roll out the dough into 7 inch rotis & cook on the tawa.
For the Mexican Sauce:
Heat oil in a pan.
Add cumin seeds, green chillies, garlic, onion (chopped), tomato paste, basil leaves, oregano and saute till brownish red.
Then add sugar, salt and tomato ketchup; bring to a boil.
For the Quesadilla:
Take the tortilla and spread Mexican sauce over it.
Add a small portion of cheese over the sauce.
In one half of the tortilla, put all the veggies and jalapeños.
Add chilli flakes over the top. Now put the remaining amount of cheese.
Fold the other half tortilla over this. Brush oil & cook on a tawa.
Cut into 3 pieces and enjoy with the salsa.

name: Puy Lentil & Green Onion Crumble
instructions: To make the crumble, mix the butter with the flour till it resembles a coarse sand-like texture.
Then add the parmesan, chopped thyme, salt & pepper.
Mix again till fully combined and let it chill in the fridge.
For the Puy Lentil mixture, add oil in a pan, and sauté the garlic & onion. Add the carrot and cook till soft.
Now add in the green onion, followed by puy lentil. Do not forget to season at each step as you go. This will help to achieve a better taste.
Add the water chestnut and tomato concasse.
Add cream when it thickens up and turn the heat off.
Finish off by adding mustard & herbs.
Taste one last time and adjust the seasoning.
Preheat oven at 180 degree. In an ovenproof bowl, add in the lentil mixture and top it with crumble; bake for 15-20 minutes or till the top is nicely brown & bubbling.
Drizzle some extra virgin olive oil & enjoy.

name: Aloo ka Halwa
instructions: Boil the potatoes and peel off the skin. Once, done mash it with your hands.
In a pan, pour some ghee and let it heat. Then add the mashed potatoes and let it roast for 1-2 minutes
Add milk, sugar and raisins to the potatoes and mix them well.
Cook for another 8-10 minutes and stir frequently.
Add cardamom and stir.
Garnish with flaked almonds & cashews. Serve hot.

name: Falhari Pakore
instructions: Wash, peel and cut the potatoes into small cubes. Mix in the buckwheat flour.
Add the rest of the ingredients to the potatoes and mix well.
Add little water in intervals and keep on mixing till you get a thick batter. It should be thicker than idli batter.
Heat oil in a pan for deep frying.
With the help of a tablespoon, shape the batter with your hands and drop the shaped batter in hot oil.
Fry till the pakoras are golden and crisp. Drain the excessive oil with the help of a napkin.
Serve them hot with freshly made mint yoghurt dip.

name: Arbi Kofta with Mint Yoghurt Dip
ingredients: 3-4 Tbsp water chestnut flour, kuttu ka aata
instructions: Boil the arbi in a pressure cooker or in a pan till it becomes soft.
Peel them all and add the rest of the ingredients.
Mash well and mix everything uniformly.
While shaping the kofta, you can apply some oil on your palms as the mixture is sticky.
Shape into cylinders and pan fry them with some oil till golden brown.
Serve Arbi Kofta hot with mint yoghurt dip.
Mint Yoghurt Dip:
Hang yoghurt to drain excess water.
Mix chopped mint and cucumber to the yoghurt.
Add rock salt.

name: Chocolate Cake in a Pressure Cooker
instructions: In a mixing bowl, sift the flour, cocoa powder and baking powder.
Add in the butter, sugar, salt, water and vanilla, and beat the ingredients using a whisk.
Add the eggs and beat the batter until smooth.
Transfer into the baking tin.
Heat the pressure cooker, covered with the lid but without the pressure, for 3-4 minutes on high heat, then place the cake tin in the empty cooker (do not add water in the cooker).
Close the lid (without the pressure), lower the flame and let it cook until done (about 30 minutes).

name: Honey Chilli Potatoes
instructions: For the potatoes:
In a bowl, add cornflour or maida, salt and red chilli powder.
Add the sliced potatoes and mix well until the potatoes are coated.
Heat oil in a wok and deep fry the potatoes until golden. Keep aside.
For the Base:
In a wok, add oil, garlic paste and spring onions. Saute on high heat for 1 minute.
Add capsicum, honey, salt, soya sauce, chilli sauce. Saute for 2-3 minutes.
Add the deep-fried potatoes and sesame seeds. Mix well and serve hot.

name: Vegetable Momos
instructions: Mix the maida, salt and baking powder and knead to a stiff dough with water.
Heat oil and add the onion and garlic.
Saute over high heat and add the carrot and cabbage. Turn around over high heat till glossy.
Take it off the heat and mix in the Soya sauce, salt, vinegar and black pepper.
Roll the dough thin (translucent) and cut into 4"-5" rounds.
Take a round, wet edges and place some filling in the center.
Bring edges together to cover the filling. Twist to seal and fill the rest in the same way.
Steam for about 10 minutes and serve with soya sauce and chilli sauce.

name: Chole Bhature
ingredients: 1 tsp whole pepper corns (sabut kali mirch)
1 green chili (chopped)                      1 tea bag                                                1 Tbsp butter
1/2 tsp yeast, dissolved for 10 minutes in luke warm water
instructions: For chole:
In a pan add oil, bay leaf, cinnamon, cumin seeds, cloves, whole pepper corns, green and black cardamom.
After it gets brown add chopped onions and saute it.
After sauteing add chopped ginger and garlic.
Then add turmeric, chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, asafoetida, salt and fry well.
For de glazing the pan add little water.
Now add the chole (soaked overnight and pressure cooked) to the masala.
After stirring well add tomatoes, little sugar and salt to the chole (chickpeas)
Now add ajwain, chopped green chilies and water for the base.
To get the color in the chole, add a tea bag to the masala.
Simmer the chole gently for an hour and cover it.
Add lime juice and a dollop of butter to it.
Garnish the chole with coriander and butter.
Serve the chole hot with bhaturas.
For the bhaturas:
Knead the whole wheat flour, maida and salt together with adequate amount of water.
Sprinkle the yeast on top. Leave it for 2-3 hours for the yeast to work.
Divide it into equal portions. Roll out in an oval or round shape.
Deep fry till golden brown, like a puri.
Serve.

name: Quick Chicken Curry
instructions: Heat oil in a pan and sauté the onion paste, garlic & ginger paste till golden brown.
Add tomato puree. When the tomato puree dries up, add coriander powder, cumin powder, garam masala, red chilli powder, turmeric powder and salt. Let the spices cook.
Add chicken pieces into the masala. Stir well and cook till they are golden brown.
Add 1/2 cup of water and stir. Cover with a lid and let it simmer till the chicken is cooked.
Garnish with chopped coriander and serve.

name: Butter Chicken
instructions: For marinating the chicken
In a mixing bowl, mix red chilli powder, ginger garlic paste, salt and curd.
Add the raw chicken pieces to the marinade and mix well. Keep it in the refrigerator overnight or minimum 6 hours.
Roast the marinated chicken in a tandoor or an oven for about 10-12 minutes until it is three-fourth done.
For the chicken gravy
Heat half the quantity of white butter in pan.
Pour in the tomato puree, and saute for 2-3 minutes. Add cumin seeds, sugar, red chilli powder and salt. Mix well.
Add the prepared chicken, white butter, fresh cream, sliced green chillies and crushed fenugreek leaves.  Saute for 3-4 minutes and let the chicken cook.
Cook till chicken is done. Serve hot with rice or naan.

name: Idli Burger
ingredients: 2 cups of diced vegetables (peas, carrot and potatoes)
instructions: Heat oil and fry idlis till golden brown. Make sure they're crisp on the outside and soft on the inside.
Apply chutney on each side  of  the idli.
Boil diced vegetables till well done. Drain water and allow them to cool.

Saute
 onion, add ginger-garlic paste, turmeric, chilli powder, coriander powder and garammasala. Saute for a couple of minutes and then let it cool.

Mash the vegetables and onion mixture. Add maida, coriander leaves and 
salt to taste, mix well.
Make cutlets that are about the same size as the idlis. Shallow fry cutlets till golden brown.
How to assemble burger - Place the cutlet in the middle, and then add onion and tomato slices sandwiching the cutlet.

name: Crispy Spinach
instructions: Fry the spinach and put it on a oil absorbent paper.
Heat the wok, throw in the garlic and add onion, chilly and spinach along with seasoning.
Toss all the vegetables together in the wok for 30 seconds which will impart a smoky flavor and blend the ingredients together.
Serve hot on the plate.

name: Sarson Ki Gilawat with Corn and Cheese Tostadas
instructions: Take desi ghee in a pan, add crushed coriander seeds and cumin.
Add saag and spinach and cook on slow flame.
Add achaarmasala and salt to taste. Keep the mixture aside to cool.
Add roasted chana powder for binding and make small patties.
Cook the sarson ki gilawat on hot griddle to form a crust on gilawat.
For corn tostadas, add coriander to chopped corn and stuff inside small dough to make tostada.
Serve sarson ki gilawat with corn tostadas.

name: Malai Kofta
instructions: For the koftas:
Refrigerate the boiled potatoes for 4 to 6 hours as this makes it easy to cook koftas.
Mash the boiled potatoes, paneer, maida. The mix should not be too hard or too soft. Add salt, chopped coriander leaves and mix well.
Cut the raisins and cashew nuts into very small pieces and add 1/2 tsp of sugar to the mix.
Heat up the oil for deep frying.
Roll out the balls from the dough you prepared and stuff the dry fruit mix in the centre.
Fry the koftas and if they break in hot oil then dust them with dry maida before putting them in.
For the gravy:
Fry some onion, ginger garlic paste and tomato paste.
Mix the cashew nut paste with 2 Tbsp of warm milk and pour it into the paste.
Except kasturi methi, add all the dry masala into the paste and saute till the oil separates itself.
Add  and a half cup of water and simmer the gravy till it's done.
Add cream/malai, 1 Tbsp of sugar and kasturi methi.
Simmer the gravy till the oil starts separating and once it's done, put the fried koftas into the gravy and serve hot with chapatis.

name: Rajma Kebab
instructions: Soak rajma (kidney beans) overnight in water.
Remove its skin by pouring boiling water over it.
Grind rajma into a coarse paste.
Add chopped onion, green chillies, tomatoes, chilli powder, coriander powder, lemon juice, peanuts and salt.
Now add besan (gram flour) and mix well.
Mix by hand and work into small rolls.
Deep fry in hot oil/ghee till golden brown.

name: Corn & Cauliflower Soup
instructions: Take a pan and add some olive oil. Throw in the sliced onions and stir it well. Then add the garlic.
Add the cauliflower florets and cook for 2 to 3 minutes.
Put in the cashew nut paste and mix well. Then add corn and water and cover the pan with a lid.
Let it cook it on medium flame and then once its done, allow it to cool.
Pour it in a blender and drop in the slice of bread and blend till you get a smooth paste.
Now transfer the paste into a deep pan. Lower the flame to medium and add milk, black pepper powder, fresh cream, sugar and salt as per taste.
Bring to boil.
Garnish with crushed corn and serve.

name: Thekua
instructions: Take crushed almonds and cashew nuts,  mix with ghee and sweet soda.
Keep mixing for about 5 minutes.
Add sugar in water and bring to boil.
Add water to the mixture to form dough.
Add oil in a vessel and let it heat.
